chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely heavily on chemoreception for detecting food particles and environmental cues. They lack nervous systems, but cells can respond to chemical gradients.

mechanoreception.notes: Sponges can detect water currents and physical stimuli via specialized cells. This is important for filter feeding and coordinating their oscula.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Desmanthidae is not mentioned in the provided text.
